p: Despite progresses made over the past decades to decline the mortality rate of malaria all over the world, it is still prevalent in some tropical countries and areas with about 200 million affected cases in 2013. Vector control interventions have had substantial contribution on the recent reduction in global malaria burden. Larviciding, with the aim of adult vector density reduction, as an auxiliary to core interventions, is helpful especially in urban regions, where breeding of vectors take places in permanent or semi-permanent aquatic habitats ( 1). The mosquito Anopheles stephensi is one of the six main vectors of human malaria in southern parts of Iran ( 2). Larvicidal potentials of some herbal extracts and essential oils on An. stephensi larvae have been investigated previously ( 3â€“ 5).
